{"step_by_step_thinking": "The lingual fossa is a concavity or depression on the lingual surface of a tooth. It is more commonly seen in the incisors. To determine which incisor has the most prominent lingual fossa, we need to consider the anatomy of the incisors. The upper incisors have a more pronounced lingual fossa compared to the lower incisors. Among the upper incisors, the central incisors are larger and have a more prominent lingual fossa compared to the lateral incisors. Therefore, the correct answer is C. Upper Central Incisor.", "answer_choice": "C"}
